data.title: South Korea’s Yoon lifts martial law after political gamble
data.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said he will rescind his martial law decree, giving in to the parliament’s opposition just hours after his dramatic move imposing it that shook markets and surprised other world leaders.

data.title: Soulful grooves
data.description: On a recent warm Bangkok evening, Shintaro Sakamoto stepped onto the stage at Maho Rasop Music Festival for his first-ever performance in Thailand. For fans of the Japanese singer/songwriter, it was an electrifying moment -- a rare opportunity to witness the visionary artist who has quietly redefined modern music with his eclectic blend of soft rock, reggae, bossa nova and psychedelia. As a founding member of the legendary rock band Yura Yura Teikoku and now a celebrated solo artist, Sakamoto

data.title: German Christmas market comes to Bangkok
data.description: Gearing up for the festive season, Goethe-Institut Thailand is organising the German Christmas Market 2024 on Sathon 1 this Saturday and Sunday, bringing joy to downtown Bangkok.

data.title: BMS rings in festive season with concert
data.description: Bangkok Music Society (BMS) is holding its festive season concert at the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Thailand, Sukhumvit 50, on Saturday starting at 4pm.

data.title: Angels gunning for home win in ACL 2
data.description: Bangkok United will be going all-out for the top spot when they face Nam Dinh at home in an AFC Champions League Two Group G encounter on Wednesday.

data.title: Unesco experts to visit rail project in Ayutthaya soon
data.description: Experts from Unesco

data.title: Visions of the future
data.description: Thailand has long been celebrated for its vibrant traditions and unique cultural identity. Yet, in Tomorrow And I, Netflix

data.title: Illustration fair returns to CentralWorld
data.description: The Bangkok Illustration Fair is back with works by Thai and foreign illustrators at CentralWorld Live, 8th floor of CentralWorld, Ratchadamri Road, from tomorrow to Sunday.

data.title: Staying in the swing beyond 60
data.description: As l edge slowly and carefully out of bed whilst discovering new twinges of pain, the reality of having to smack a little ball around a course later in the day becomes a worrying harsh reality.

data.title: Step into the future on Dec 4
data.description: What happens if technology disrupts morality and traditional Thai customs? Discover the answers in “Tomorrow And I”, which premiers on Netflix on Dec 4 is an anthology series that takes viewers on a journey through a futuristic Thailand where technology has become an inescapable part of daily life.

data.title: Phuket cabaret seen as lucrative cash cow
data.description: Phuket cabaret is a "soft power" of the province that can generate over 200 million baht in revenue a year, according to provincial governor Sophon Suwanrat.

data.title: 4 Thais safe after Myanmar navy incident
data.description: Four Thai nationals detained in Myanmar remain safe after their boat allegedly strayed into Myanmar waters in the Andaman Sea on Saturday, the government said yesterday.

data.title: 40% of fathers smoke, survey shows
data.description: Almost four in ten fathers in Thailand smoke cigarettes, which mostly has a negative influence on their children, especially as more young people are now vaping while the average age of people who vape drops each year, according to new survey findings.

data.title: Govt plans new handout for farmers
data.description: The cabinet has approved a new programme to support over four million households which rely on agriculture across the country, which would see about 38.5 billion baht in financial assistance rolled out to replace the fertiliser co-payment scheme that was terminated by the government yesterday.

data.title: Cabinet okays B5bn budget for 16 more provinces
data.description: The cabinet yesterday approved a budget of five billion baht to assist households affected by flooding in 16 additional provinces, with similar payouts made to those previously impacted by floods.

data.title: Welfare boost for 3 vulnerable groups
data.description: Monthly allowance increases for newborn children, elderly and disabled people are expected to be implemented on Oct 1 next year, according to Varawut Silpa-archa, Minister of Social Development and Human Security (MSDHS).

data.title: Farmland to be confiscated
data.description: Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat on Tuesday vowed that the agricultural land found to have been used unlawfully for operating Phu Nub Dao Farm in Saraburi will be confiscated.

data.title: Boonsong release stirs flap
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra denied speculation that the release on parole of former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was convicted of corruption in an earlier rice-pledging scheme, would pave the way for the possible return of fugitive ex-premier Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: South Korean president declares emergency martial law, blames opposition
data.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared an “emergency martial law,” Tuesday accusing the country’s opposition of controlling the parliament, sympathizing with North Korea and paralyzing the government with anti-state activities.

data.title: South Korean president declares martial law
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea’s president has declared emergency martial law in the country, accusing opposition forces of anti-state activities.

data.title: European police crack criminals’ messaging service
data.description: AMSTERDAM - An encrypted messaging service that was used for international drug and arms trafficking has been taken down by European authorities, Europol said on Tuesday.
